verses.text: And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made clothes of service, to do service in the holy \add place\add* , and made the holy garments for Aaron; as the LORD commanded Moses.
And he made the ephod \add of\add* gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
And they beat the gold into thin plates, and cut \add it into\add* wires, to work \add it\add* in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, \add with\add* curious work.
They made shoulder-pieces for it, to couple \add it\add* together: by the two edges was it coupled together.

And the curious girdle of his ephod, that \add was\add* upon it, \add was\add* of the same, according to the work thereof; \add of\add* gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as the LORD commanded Moses.
And they wrought onyx stones inclosed in ouches of gold, graven as signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.
And he put them on the shoulders of the ephod, \add that they should be\add* stones for a memorial to the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses.
And he made the breast-plate \add of\add* curious work, like the work of the ephod; \add of\add* gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
It was foursquare; they made the breast-plate double: a span \add was\add* the length of it, and a span the breadth of it, \add being\add* doubled.
And they set in it four rows of stones: \add the first\add* row \add was\add* a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this \add was\add* the first row.
And the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
And the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: \add they were\add* inclosed in ouches of gold in their inclosings.

And the stones \add were\add* according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, \add like\add* the engravings of a signet, every one with his name, according to the twelve tribes.
And they made upon the breast-plate chains at the ends, \add of\add* wreathed work \add of\add* pure gold.
And they made two ouches \add of\add* gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings in the two ends of the breast-plate.
And they put the two wreathed chains of gold in the two rings on the ends of the breast-plate.
And the two ends of the two wreathed chains they fastened in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, before it.
And they made two rings of gold, and put \add them\add* on the two ends of the breast-plate, upon the border of it, which \add was\add* on the side of the ephod inward.

And they made two \add other\add* golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, towards the forepart of it, over against the \add other\add* coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod:

And they bound the breast-plate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breast-plate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the LORD commanded Moses.
And he made the robe of the ephod \add of\add* woven work, all \add of\add* blue.
And \add there was\add* a hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of an habergeon, \add with\add* a band around the hole, that it should not rend.
And they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates \add of\add* blue, and purple, and scarlet, \add and\add* twined \add linen\add* .
And they made bells \add of\add* pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, around between the pomegranates;
A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the hem of the robe to minister \add in\add* ; as the LORD commanded Moses.
And they made coats \add of\add* fine linen, \add of\add* woven work, for Aaron and for his sons,
And a miter \add of\add* fine linen, and goodly bonnets \add of\add* fine linen, and linen breeches \add of\add* fine twined linen,
And a girdle \add of\add* fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, \add of\add* needle-work; as the LORD commanded Moses.
And they made the plate of the holy crown \add of\add* pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, \add like to\add* the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
And they tied to it a lace of blue, to fasten \add it\add* on high upon the miter; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Thus was all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did they.
And they brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent, and all its furniture, its buttons, its boards, its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets,
And the covering of rams' skins dyed red, and the covering of badgers' skins, and the vail of the covering,
The ark of the testimony, and its staffs, and the mercy-seat,
The table, \add and\add* all its vessels, and the show-bread,
The pure candlestick, \add with\add* its lamps, \add even with\add* the lamps to be set in order, and all its vessels, and the oil for light,
And the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the tabernacle-door,
The brazen altar, and its grate of brass, its staffs, and all its vessels, the laver and its foot,

The hangings of the court, its pillars, and its sockets, and the hanging for the court-gate, its cords, and its pins, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of the congregation,
The clothes of service to do service in the holy \add place\add* , and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons' garments, to minister in the priest's office.
According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.
And Moses looked upon all the work, and behold, they had done it as the LORD had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
